page.title: 10CHANGES AT ISABELLA COLLIERY
page.content: In 1966 the Isabella pit closed down and it is now difficult to realise that coal was mined there.The pitheap has been landscaped. All the old colliery houses were pulled down in 1982 and the first row of new houses and flats have been completed. Mrs. Bowart, whose husband was a miner, moved to Isabella in 1956 and remembers it as a village surrounded by fields. Her first house in West Row had no water or electricity, the tap and lavatory being outside. The family bathed in a tin bath in front of the fire. Her second house , in New Row, had a sitting room, kitchenette, three bedrooms, bathroom, electricity and an outside lavatory.Last year she moved into her new two_bedroomed,gas_ centrally heated flat in West Court (where West Row used to be).She likes it but preferred her house in New Row.
